TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed StandardEventLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the standard event levels that are used in the Event Log service. The level defines the severity of the event. Custom event levels can be defined beyond these standard levels. For more information about levels, see .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel Critical = int32(1)

Docs.summary: This level corresponds to critical errors, which is a serious error that has caused a major failure.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel Error = int32(2)

Docs.summary: This level corresponds to normal errors that signify a problem.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel Informational = int32(4)

Docs.summary: This level corresponds to informational events or messages that are not errors. These events can help trace the progress or state of an application.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel LogAlways = int32(0)

Docs.summary: This value indicates that not filtering on the level is done during the event publishing.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel Verbose = int32(5)

Docs.summary: This level corresponds to lengthy events or messages.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.StandardEventLevel Warning = int32(3)

Docs.summary: This level corresponds to warning events. For example, an event that gets published because a disk is nearing full capacity is a warning event.
